Hello Tom! I scrolled up through the chat-How are you, and how's Mark?

I don't even know how irritated I am anymore. This is just a whole 'nother level. My audio interface company finally got back to me about getting a driver for my system that won't BSoD on me and fix the CPU throttling this morning.
Immediately after downloading, the CPU throttling persisted, and it didn't take 5 minutes for it to BSoD on me again. Then twice more trying to boot back up.
It's some serious next level bullshittery.

The dmp files that were created as a result of the crashes specify the audio interface drivers as the issue, so they got sent off to their tech support, hopefully they can parse them and figure out exactly wtf is going on.
i hope so. is this the same laptop that is giving you trouble?
This happened across two different laptops, so it's the drivers. Or (hopefully not!) the iterface itself.

The repair shop was able to get my original laptop working agian through "resetting some drivers". The laptop functioned just fine as it always had UNTIL I tried reinstalling the interface drivers and then it all went to shit again.
And the new laptop I got while the old one was in the shop had the same issue with crashing starting after the drivers installed.
something must be corrupted in those drivers?

I deleted the old ones and started fresh. Likely, it's that it's conflicting with something somewhere else. Though Hell if I know where. I already disabled all the stock audio drivers and tested that to no avail as well.
It's really hard to tell without more diagnosis
I know how to open up the BSoD dumps and find the surface level issues, but I'm not nearly tech savvy enough to deep dive much further.
like get to the root of the problem

Aye, I know that "The problem seems to be caused by the following file: FocusriteUSB.sys  SYSTEM_THREAD_EXCEPTION_NOT_HANDLED" means that the Focusrite driver is being fucky, but after deleting it, reinstalling, and rebooting, I am at a loss for why.
